column5: Looks like we're about one shave away from Movember! Anyone else going to sport something for the month ahead?  http://ca.movember.com/
im in as well i did it last year as well,people at my work are doing it too.!!! great cause

Count me in !!! Our family has just recently found out my uncle has Prostate cancer and I lost my Aunt just a few months ago ( age 56 ) to Cancer and MS . This Movember kind of hits close to home.  http://mobro.co/Tyhatts  I went from this @ 7 am....   To this.... hahah First time I have taken a razor to my face in 4 yrs..... it feels VERY odd
I've had a moustache for 40 years, if I was to shave it off my daughter wouldn't know me and my wife would wonder who the heck was sitting across from her at supper time

I'm also participating this year however I had to cheat and pre-grew mine all october.  I have a wedding to shoot this coming saturday and a 5 day old moustache will not help my professional image at all, so this was my only option. http://mobro.co/brandonbroderick   Movember by bbroderick86, on Flickr

I used to have a stach for years, shaved it off one day and everyone told me it made me look younger. So I kept it off but since my dentures no longer fit and i'm gumming it until i get the nerve up to by another set (and potentially waste another $2000)I think i'll give the movember thing a try and see what it looks like again (too bad it's going to be grey)
I'm in, going with the "balding caterpillar on my lip" look again this year.
My son is in, although he wiped it on his sleeve right after this photo.
oh we need pic's of the growth stages every Friday!
May go with Novembeard but Movember ain't happening.  Yes, the cause is worthy and will support any friend by the end of the month who wears it best.
Same and I'm working on mine too
I'm groing a handlebar  Mike Brown style...  p.-
